trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses Eclipse and Android 4.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses Eclipse and Android 4.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app].
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Mobile Services Android SDK has been updated to version 2.0.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Mobile Services Android SDK has been updated to version 2.0.

trans-unit.source: If you completed the above two tutorials some time ago, you must redo them if they are not using the updated SDK.
trans-unit.target: If you completed the above two tutorials some time ago, you must redo them if they are not using the updated SDK.

trans-unit.source: To verify what version of the SDK your app uses, open it in Eclipse and inspect the contents of the **libs** folder.
trans-unit.target: To verify what version of the SDK your app uses, open it in Eclipse and inspect the contents of the **libs** folder.

trans-unit.source: The version numbers on the Mobile Services jar files should be 2.0 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The version numbers on the Mobile Services jar files should be 2.0 or higher.
